intro: Securidaca declinata, commonly known as the slender senna, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The seeds are enclosed in narrow, elongated pods that split open when mature to release the seeds.
